Summary Heading: Bad service for loyal repeat visitors
Summary: The cleaning staff here at Delta Hotels is subpar, the front desk staff are okay as long as they like you.  On multiple occasions my Titanium Elite Status has been completely ignored upon check-in.  On this occasion they have ignored it and put me into a room that was clearly trashed by previous guests and the hotel staff neglected to maintain the room before releasing it back to the house.  The door on the outside (hallway facing) had a hole punched in it. Inside the room the desk had cigarette burns, the closet doors were patched up, the coat hangers were falling off the wall, the sheer curtains were gone, TV didn’t work with any type of input options, couch had stains on it, the bathroom shelving was missing, and the phone didn’t work.  They  HAD to know what type of room
Manager Response: Dear J R.  Thank you so much for taking the time out of your busy day to provide us with your valuable feedback.  I have shared your feedback with the entire leadership team to see what it is we can do better so this will be an isolated incident.  Sincerely,  Yvonne Liu General Manager Delta Hotels by Marriott Anaheim Garden Grove

Summary: We stayed here for our Thanksgiving/Christmas family vacation. From Nov 26th they Dec 2nd. The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable and we came back to clean fresh towels everyday. The breakfast was delicious. The waiter and omelet cook were great. We stayed for 6 nights and each time we arrived or left we were greeted or told to have a great day. The ART shuttle picked up right outside the hotel and was so convenient. We definitely will be staying again!!
Room tip: Parking was pretty full on the weekends but was ok throughout the week
Manager Response: none

Summary: In town for a quick trip to Disneyland. Wanted to be close enough to the park and have a few creature comforts and not spend a fortune. The Delta sure did deliver. While it’s an older hotel that has been recently perhaps made into a Marriott Delta property. We were happy with the service. We were happy with the location and we were happy with the room. the hotel bar is lovely to have a drink at the end of the day and Jorge is just a fabulous bartender. The lobby gets very busy and he was able to manage all of the guests with a big smile on his face for every single patron. Beds are super comfy, nice and soft and lots of extra pillows. We had a king room, which had a chaise in it which is always appreciated. Wi-Fi was excellent and the shuttle stops right outside the hotel. And a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel. Easy to walk to Disneyland, takes about 30 minutes, I don’t recommend using the ART bus because it gets crowded. There are various restaurants, a Target and a coin laundry across the street in case you need them. Parking costs $20, a bit less expensive than Disneyland itself.
Room tip: Disneyland opens at 8am make sure you arrive when the park opens so you can get on rides with...
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was so I pleased about the whole experience and honestly I feel there were things that could have made it better but staff just didn’t care. Our toilet was still dirty from the previous guests :( yuck the toilet was broken and the shower stopper was broken I brought all this to the front desk where he could care less and nothing was foxed. We had to keep the tank off our toilet to keep it from non stop running. We were there for our honeymoon and it really just wasn’t very nice. I probably won’t stay here again and if not for the issues for the fact the guest service was non existent. Sooo disappointed
Manager Response: Dear Jodi R,  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations. I have shared your feedback with the entire leadership team and specially to our Maintenace department to ensure the necessary changes are improved to prevent similar situation from occurring in the future.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience while staying with us.  Sincerely,  Delta Team

Summary Heading: Good/Adequate Hotel that is Relatively Close to the Disneyland Resort
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for two nights from a Saturday - Monday in mid-December.  It was my first time staying at a Delta Hotel.  Parking:  The Hotel has a  surface parking lot in front of the hotel and large surface parking lot towards the rear.  Because I arrived around 10 pm, I needed to park in the large lot at the rear.  If you plan on arriving late, expect a 5-10 minute walk from the far reaches of the rear parking lot to the main entrance of the hotel.  Self-Parking is relatively reasonable at $20/day.  Reception Desk:  I was greeted warmly at Reception and my Platinum status with Marriott was recognized and appreciated.  I was pleased to be upgraded to the top floor Executive Room.  I did not notice any suites at the property.  Room:  The room had a standard amount of
Manager Response: Dear gin4dist3,  I have shared your feedback with the entire leadership team especially with our Maintenace department to see how we can improve our lighting and to prevent similar feedback/experience from occurring in the future.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience while staying with us.  Delta Team

Summary: From the start the stay at this hotel was unacceptable. The hotel Floor extremely hot the hotel room felt old and dirty with stained carpeting that looked like blood. The hide-a bed was like a torture  chamber. The front desk staff was pleasant but incompetent. The manager as given the chance to make our stay better failed.  The thing that was the final straw was my brand new high end suv that I was told to park in the back parking lot was never given a permit I WAS NEVER TOLD. !!!!!!!  so my vehicle could have gotten towed as NO ONE PROVIDED US WITH ONE. upon checking out I hear a guest checking in being informed of the parking process . UNACCEPTABLE. The Bar staff was amazing maybe take some pointers from them on etiquette and professionalism and details.
Manager Response: Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations. I have shared your feedback with the entire leadership team to prevent similar feedback/experience from occurring in the future.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience while staying with us.  Delta Team

Summary: Amazing choice for pre-cruise stay in LA. Great location right in the middle of Little SaiGon with amazing Vietnamese food around. Rooms are spacious, well-designed, and spotless. Will definitely be back when we’re in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights as part of our Disneyland vacation package.  Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the swimming pool and was quiet, clean and in good condition.   There is an outdoor pool and large jacuzzi which I enjoyed.   Also, this hotel includes free parking and free shuttle bus (ART) which some hotels do not offer.   The ART bus runs every 30 minutes and picked us up in front of the hotel and drops you off by the park entrance and is about 10 minute ride to Disneyland. What I enjoyed the most was the daily full hot breakfast buffet which included fresh made to order omelettes, waffles, pancakes, assorted fresh fruits, hot oatmeal, yogurts, cereal, assorted cold juices, coffee, tea and more.  Overall, I was very pleased with my stay and I think the service was
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: I had 2 of my wedding events at this hotel and the service from the beginning was horrible.  We initially had contact with Connie Esquivel who when meeting with her, quoted us a lower price per person for our events since we were having 2 events as opposed to 1 and after drafting the contract, she completely denied agreeing on said price.  My fiancé and I both met with her and witnessed the discussion of such price so for her to outright lie was completely shocking and unprofessional.  She vehemently denied agreeing to said price which completely rubbed us the wrong way from the very beginning. Even with the drafting of the agreement, I had to make so many corrections that she as the contact person should have caught herself. Fast forward to our actual events...during the first
Manager Response: Dear 383alishbaa,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience while staying with us.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations. We always strive for a perfect 10 with guest feedback and comments and we fell short at this time. You feedback has been shared with the entire leadership team especially with our sales department to better improve our service and all aspects of the hotel.  Thank you for your sharing your experience.  Sincerely,  Delta Team

Summary: This hotel was great!  We booked it for our family Disneyland trip.  Check-in was easy and the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  I didn't book connecting rooms, just asked for the rooms to be close.  They actually offered the connecting rooms and that was so nice.  The pool area was great and they provided towels.  The buffet breakfast was amazing with fresh waffles and cook to order omelets.  They had a great selection of cold and hot items.  Great start to our day!  The shuttle bus to Disney is super convenient! They pick-up right at the hotel and zip you non-stop to Disney.  Again, they pick-up from Disney and take you non-stop back to the hotel.  Mandy restaurants close by and Target just a walk across the street.  I would definitely book again!  All staff from
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary Heading: A good base for a Disneyland visit
Summary: I enjoyed my stay here while visiting Disneyland.  The room was nice and very large with an extremely comfortable bed.  Front desk staff were excellent—I had ordered Instacart to arrive before me and when I checked in they pulled it out without my asking.  When I had questions they were always available and there were no lines.  The housekeeping was disappointing as they did not service my room on one of my two full hotel days, and for me this is a big determinant in enjoying a hotel stay.  I had taken a nap midday and they did not return to clean.  Most hotels accommodate their cleaning and here they just skipped me.  Getting back to a room at midnight to have it still full of wet towels and smelling musty and like stale coffee is not great.  The pool area was pleasant but in
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary Heading: Stay here for your Disneyland trip
Summary: Great hotel with easy access to and from Disneyland. Kids had a great time in the pool, easy to walk to restaurants nearby. Had no issues with anything! Clean hotel rooms, comfy beds, and the Starbucks in the lobby got us going every day. We didn’t eat at the bar/restaurant in the lobby but I’m sure it was great.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: Stayed here for a conference at the Convention Center. Target is right across the street. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance plus a restaurant in the hotel. Great breakfast and service at Coco's Bakery in the Target parking lot.   Convention Center is only 1 mile down Harbor Blvd but that gets to be too long after a few days. I recommend buying a bus pass with Orange County Transit. There's a stop 50 yards from the Delta front door for Bus 43 and another near the Disney parking lots that's a block from the Convention Center doors.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: Booked a last minute Disneyland trip and this was one of the only hotels in the area still available. Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel. The beds were so comfortable. Rooms were fairly spacious. We were assigned an accessible room and the only downside was the toilet seat lid would not stay up. It would hit your back when you sat down. Breakfast was included with our Disney package and really nice for a hotel breakfast. Pool isn’t huge but was never crowded. Target is across the street and 4 restaurants in parking lot with more nearby. Used the ART shuttles. Worked great once I figured out it was one bus constantly on a loop and you could track it on the a-way WeGo app. (Click on routes, then grove district line (3). Give it a minute and the bus will show up on the map. Takes
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: We checked in at the Delta Hotel in Anaheim Garden Grove.  We're Marriott Bonvoy Platinum Elite members and received great recognition from this property.   Wally (Front Desk) staff provided excellent customer service during our stay.  Thank you!  5/5 Stars!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Trip to Disney
Summary: We stayed here in July for a trip to Disneyland. The staff was very friendly. Our rooms were not ready upon arrival, but we arrived before 11am. The staff was able to get us in rooms by 1pm (before check-in). The pool was small, but enjoyable. It would be nice to have beverage service at the pool. The rooms were clean/quiet, and the beds comfortable. It is walking distance to a few restaurants and Target, which is nice. It is a pretty long walk to Disney, but we used the shuttle each morning. The ubers were about $10 to Disney.  The breakfast buffet was good, and they has a great selection on items. Overall, we had a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary Heading: Adequate but could have been a lot better.
Summary: I’m a Marriott Titanium Elite and stay in dozens of Marriott branded properties every year, including lots of Delta properties. I feel I know what the brand should deliver.  I know this place isn’t the Ritz but it’s not a Fairfield Inn either.   I’d call this experience “adequate” but it’s the worst Delta experience I’ve had so far.   First, let’s talk about this COVID nonsense. Even the hotel’s TripAdvisor profile is still packed full of all this boastful “we’re doing all this stuff to protect you from COVID!” but half their hand sanitizer stations were empty and I didn’t see a single employee over the course of three days doing any public sanitizing whatsoever. So don’t lie to us. You’re not doing anything at all.   Second, using COVID as an excuse still for reduced services
Manager Response: Dear PHXroadwarrior,  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for falling short of your expectations. I have shared your feedback with the entire leadership team and specially to our housekeeping team, so we can do our best to ensure this does not occur again.  Once again, thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  Feel free to let me know if there is anything we can do to make your next stay a memorable one. We hope to see you again.  Sincerely,  Delta Team

Summary: Just spent 4 nights here with the family, two double beds on a high floor and recently renovated room made our stay extremely comfortable   Great base to visit Disneyland & Newport, highly recommended and will definitely be back
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary Heading: Don't waste your money; disappointment everywhere
Summary: We are in the middle of a 7 night stay (2 adults).  So far, have found the following: only 2 of 4 elevators working, but no signage says so at lobby level so people just wait and wait; no housekeeping for entirety of stay; jets in hot tub don't work; phone in bedroom doesn't work; light on bathroom side of bed doesn't work in base; can't control shower water temperature; exit signs in hallway doesn't work (pretty sure this is a building and fire code violation).  Couch and chairs are old and sunken and stained.  Sink drain gurgled all the time - loudly.  Walls are paper thin - I could relay the adjacent rooms' discussion word-for-word.  Saw only one employee for a 14+ story building until the weekend - then they added lots of security.  The only plus: it's near Disney.  Don't
Manager Response: Dear Guest, It is our priority to service you as our up most respected guest and I regret that we did not meet your expectation this time. I truly appreciate you taking the time and letting us know so we can improve within our hotel to become a hotel guest love. I would like to personally apologize for any inconveniences you experienced. Your feed back is very important to us and I have already shared your feedback with the entire hotel team so we can do better and improve to better service our guests in the future.  Sincerely,   Delta Team

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Good Price
Summary: This Hotel was great and was very comfortable we stayed there for three days.   My only complaints is the rooms do not have microwaves and you have to pay 20 dollars a night to park.  The pool is nice and the hot tub.  The gym is fully loaded and well equipped.  The people downstairs are very helpful.  There are a lot of places to eat around the hotel. You get complimentary water bottles all day.  The breakfast is a buffet but it costs 20 dollars a person and 10 for kids.  They have an open bar and a night restuaraunt to enjoy.  Great hotel you get your moneys worth but it is always packed due to Disneyland nearby.  Most people only stay at this hotel for disney nearby.  People come on and off all day. It is a high traffic hotel.  Expect to eat a lot while there since it lacks
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: This hotel offered the best prices in the area.  The location is good and easy to get to from LA.  The parking is paid and costs around 20.   There are few spaces at the front of the hotel and you have to park in the Marriott Suites parking lot.   The rooms were clean and bed lines were fresh.  I had a good view of as far as LA from my room.     The breakfast is buffet style.   Front desk was helpful.     There are plenty of dining options within walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: I stayed here for a couple of nights recently and I had a great experience! I was helped my Gina at the front desk multiple times and she made it a memorable stay for us. The location is good if you want to go to Disneyland, and if you get an Uber to go back and forth its only around $10. Great location, great staff, and I will be staying here again next time I'm in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: Do not stay here! I repeat do not stay here. This hotel was so horrible everything went completely wrong. The front desk staff is not an actual staff just a bunch of random people who they hired to do a subpar job. One of the managers (Miguel) in particular is absolutely impossible to deal with he will make you regret staying there. Stuff is poorly trained and don’t know how to operate the hotel. I had so many issues while staying there for one week they stole items from my room as well as they still haven’t given me back deposit! Like this place is a scam and needs to go out of business honestly,  It was just that bad! I’m very well travel at this by far is the worst place I’ve ever been in my life! Take my advice. There are several many hotels in the area just buy a different
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: This is a pretty standard 3-4 star hotel- could use a refresh, but if using it for one quick night, as I was, it is more than adequate and quite comfortable.  Incredible welcome from Liz @ reception, who went above and beyond.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: My sister and I stayed here for 4 nights. We got a great deal through Costco that included free parking, free breakfast, and free shuttle passes.  Pros: Every employee we interacted with was fantastic - especially those in the restaurant at breakfast. Great location - close to Disneyland (only a $6 uber ride), but very quiet. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was great - made to order egg dishes and everything was fresh. But we had free vouchers - would not have paid $17/pp. Pool and hot tub were a great temperature and nicely landscaped. Target right across the street and MANY walkable food options.  Cons: Our room had an unpleasant odor - reminded me of old smoking rooms. Sink and mirror were in the bathroom with the shower/toilet - it made getting ready in the morning slower.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: I’ve stayed at this place a few times and the main things I can comment on that could use improvement would be at the water in the bathroom and shower is extremely hard and it makes your skin very dry. For this reason I cannot stay at this hotel for more than one night at a time because my skin suffers. It’s possible that the water softener at the hotel is not working or it’s simply not softening the water enough.   I’ve also found carpet in some of the rooms I’ve stayed in to be overly stained.   Other than that, it’s good value for money
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary Heading: Understaffed, Neglected, Dirty Hotel in Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: Old Wyndham Resort type property purchased by Marriott several years ago. Still looks as though it is undergoing renovations and property is semi-neglected, has a run down dirty feeling with dirty floors, hallways and is grossly understaffed. The rooms are average in size but look to have renovated in recent years with upgraded Marriott fixtures/bedding etc. the hallways, elevators and common areas of the hotel were in need of attention. Walking to the elevator from the lobby there were several pieces of random trash on the floor, the tile ps were broken, cracked in the elevators and had a general dirty feeling. After exiting the elevator, the trash on the floor was still visible with misc. napkins, Kleenex, q-tips and just general trash scattered throughout. Not the trash
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Front Desk

Summary: To anyone planning an event at this hotel - please BEWARE! In case of an emergency, you will NOT get your money back!  Most uncooperative management I have ever dealt with.  My wedding was scheduled for June 2020, however, the pandemic did not allow me to have my wedding as planned. My husband and I were supposed to fly out from Canada to California to celebrate our events with our families, but unfortunately essential travel between US and Canada was banned at the time and we couldn't travel.  Moreover, our parents couldn't fly out either because they are high risk.  Even if everyone was to fly out, there is no way we could host an event for 160 people in the midst of the pandemic.      It's been over a year and Delta hasn't refunded our money back. Multiple vendors and venues
Manager Response: none

Summary: The beds were very comfortable, comparable to my home bed.  The bathroom was large and clean/neat.  There are very nice amenities like a pool and hot tub.  Very close to Disneyland, and Block of Orange.    Only thing to improve would be to include a microwave in the room.  And maybe a retractable clothes line for swim suits.    We will stay at this hotel again when we visit family and Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Getto crowd. Low riders playing rap music outside in the parking lot. No bell captain.  It looks like a neglected property. Dirty parking lot & entry. Old scuffed up elevators. Neighborhood is not safe. One guy was walking against traffic & refused to get out of the street.  Cop cars showed up & the guy was combative with the police.   The room itself, was nicely remodeled; however, the towels were so small that I could not even cover myself.  I have a 32’ inch waist and the length was about 31’. Most towels are 40’-50’.  The quality was commercial-grade, rough & thin. Unbelievable.   This place is so getto we only stayed one night & checked into a nicer hotel (JW).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not only is this hotel nicely located (nearby Disneyland, close enough to highway, etc.) but the rooms are spaceous and impeccably clean. In addition, Elizabeth & Lana at the front desk were friendly, professional, and were attentive to our every question and request. Excellent service and beautiful hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is located nearby Disneyland and located by lots of restaurants.  The service at the hotel was good and the staff was helpful in showing me around Anaheim to get to restaurants and the freeway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Delta is a new name for me with Marriott. Being a Marriott I make certain assumptions about the property. This property in Garden Grove is a huge disappointment! The entrance and lobby is filthy.  There was a vandalized vehicle in the lot for days and another vehicle that appeared to be a residence. Room was acceptable, but the hall ways were also dirty. The same food crumbs were outside my room the entire stay so halls are not being vacuumed. I know this comment is not going to be popular but evidently this is a pet friendly hotel and the dogs were everywhere and their owners were impervious to others possible allergies  or fears because they allowed their pets to "sniff away"as well as contribute to the floors filth. Speaking of the not cleaning, the pool appeared to not have
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Rooms are nice, but has really gone downhill during Covid
Summary: The rooms are newly renovated and nice, had stayed before and really enjoyed it.  However, with Covid the rates have been cut attracting a different clientele and it shows.  The elevators were dirty and full of graffiti.  The parking lot area has too many people hanging around that don't seem to belong.  You would think you were in Compton rather than a block from Disneyland.  Masks on guests were not being enforced.  That said, the staff were nice.  The room itself is still nice and was clean.  Bonvoy Titanium got me free parking instead of $20, a nice surprise.  No food, no breakfast, no pantry during Covid, but that is most hotels now.     Probably won't return until well after Covid.  If back in the area will look for something a little more upscale.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here during Labor Day weekend and what a nightmare. When we first arrived at hotel, we were turned off by what we saw that we tried to get another hotel. Unfortunately everything was booked so we had no choice but to stay.  The only redeeming quality of the place was the room which was comfortable. But that was about it. Now with the cons...  During these times of Covid, the hotel was a definitely a cesspool to catch something. There were so many wet dripping people hanging out in the lobby and the elevator was musty and wet from all the people coming from the pool. The pool area was filled to the brim and resembled the pool scene from the movie Gremlins when the gremlins were multiplying at the YMCA pool. Many people including staff were not wearing masks. No kind of
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good to know what companies prioritize money over the safety of their guests. I would give 0 stars if possible. I walked into the hotel to find that there were several guests in the lobby eating and not wearing masks, hotel staff not wearing masks and not enforcing social distancing (lady talking to the staff was closer than the roped off area not in front of the glass shield and was talking without a mask to hotel staff who were also without masks). In the 5 mins I was there, I noticed at least 8 people not wearing masks and none of them were being asked to wear masks or socially distance by the staff despite being within 6 feet. I asked if they would cancel my reservation which they said they understood and would agree to it on their end but I would need to talk to my agency
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: this is the place to stay...staff will make you feel like your at home...
Summary: Excellent service ...employees like Kevin at the front desk, he is destined to succeed in all that he does... The rooms are clean and they are spacious and just comfortable to be in. They have filtered water next to the ice machines so u can refill whenever you want... I want to express my gratitude to Lee, I appreciate you treating me civilized, thank you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel does not honor Marriott's coivd19 refund policies. They are happy to cancel your stay and say they will refund your money, and then 90 days later say that they aren't actually going to give you the refund. They do offer free parking instead at that specific hotel, which is totally worth the $1000 they stole.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel for close to work and quiet for off hours.  Clean rooms Great helpful staff Gina in the night staff is great!  Morning staff (don’t recall their names - the guys) are helpful for local suggestions.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We traveled to this hotel in anticipation of a Disney Vacation, however given the current global circumstances our trip was cut short to a single night as the parks announced they were closing shortly after we arrived(no fault of the hotel) and our government was recommending the immediate return of all citizens.  When we notified the hotel upon check-in that we would only be staying one night (of our pre-paid 4 night stay) given the situation, the front desk personnel laughed in our faces telling us we were overreacting and continued to make snide comments as they checked us in.  We reached out to Marriot to request a credit for the nights not used as we intend on returning to use our purchased park passes at a later date.  Marriot responded that it was an independently owned
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautifully updated hotel with great staff
Summary: Place is always very clean and neat with recent renovations completed-- however the water dispensing machines by the ice machines need to be cleaned and emptied now and then so they don't smell of mildew.   Internet speed is acceptable but could be improved... tend to be slow sometimes.  Overall, staff are professional and nice.  They always grant us the room and floor that we desire and the rooms are always ready BEFORE our indicated arrival time--- that is HUGE ... make us feel like they have worked hard to prepare for our arrival.   Wonderful employees to acknowledge:  Wally  and Augie at front desk always greet us by name plus a great big smile.  Jackie, Letticia and Samuel at the restaurant --- always get very warm, attentive, professional services from them --make us feel
Manager Response: none

Summary: It’s a little further from the convention centre (a good 30 mins walk) but otherwise generally good. Got a huge Target supermarket just across the road including a CVS Pharmacy in it so getting supplies are easy. Just below the hotel on the left are a few dining options such as Joe’s Crab Shack, Outback, Red Robin burgers and Oggi’s Pizza. Across the road next to Target are more eateries. So one can enjoy convenience yet without the buzz of hotels much nearer to Disneyland. After all, it's not too expensive to uber around.   Glad that the room was ready for check in when I arrived, which is a good 2 hrs before the official check in time. The hotel room and bathroom is a comfortable size for 2 and definitely huge for 1 and looks fairly new. Shower works well with a low bathtub so
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: CAUTION – To anyone with physical disabilities. Treated unfairly.
Summary: CAUTION – To anyone with physical disabilities. This team does NOT treat you fairly or with respect!  We made the reservation at the Marriott in Garden Grove as my physically handicapped wife would be travelling alone. We have stayed at this property in the past and not had any issues with them before.  Upon my wife’s arrival on Sunday 01/26/20 she went to check in at the front desk. She was riding her handicap mobility scooter. The front desk attendant notified her that there was an issue with her credit card, so she called me. I had not given our bank a travel notice so they had not approved the charge.  This was quickly remedied and my wife asked that she run the card again. The young lady did without any issues, however her attitude became short and abrasive.   She continued
Manager Response: Thank you for notifying me of the occurrences that transpired during your wife's recent visit.  I will have discussions with all involved to ensure that this was an isolated instance!  Please contact me directly the next time that your travels bring you to our area and I will ensure that you have an exceptional stay!  Lee Severino General Manager

Summary: I was very pleased with our stay. The staff were super friendly and the room was just close to perfect. We had a very comfortable stay during our trip to Disneyland. Our Uber cost 10 max on a busy day and 7 minimum. Buying tickets at the hotel made us get a discount which was also great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked the Delta for a last minute trip, ended up extending our stay last minute and staying over 10 days. Sure glad we picked this hotel given its location and value.  Had a few problems with our first room, including sewage smell coming from the vent in the restroom. But hotel engineer quickly came and tried to fix the problem (though it wasn't resolved completely). After moving, the second room was much better. The room was clean and in good upkeep, though I can see how the walls are not very well sound proofed.   The hotel lobby was nicely decorated for the holidays. Daughter loved posing for picture next to the Christmas tree. We also enjoyed the pool, which was good size for lap swimmers but also shallow enough for kids. Perhaps due to the cooler weather, there were hardly
Manager Response: none

Summary: I brought the family to Disneyland and we stayed here for two nights. There was nothing terrible about the hotel, and there was nothing outstanding either. The room was clean and comfortable  and we were able to check in before 2:00, which helped us a lot. The breakfast restaurant breakfast buffet was good. The walk to the parking area took us around the back of the hotel down a dark and creepy walkway and drainage pipe that emptied directly onto the sidewalk. Once you got through that you had to dodge the delivery trucks to get to your car. At check in we got almost zero info that we ended up needing. Info we wish we had been given at check in:  where to pick up the shuttle to Disney, times for the shuttle, how to get tickets for the shuttle,  breakfast times, a map of the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Delta!  Please contact me the next time that you are in town and I will ensure that you have an exceptional stay!  Lee Severino

Summary Heading: It’s not bad, but there are some minor quirks
Summary: As others have noted, this is a former Wyndham. It became a Delta (Marriott’s Canadian brand) at some point in time after I stayed here in March 2018 on business.   I got this hotel while booking blind on Priceline for a Christmas leisure visit to SoCal. Initially, I was wary because of the exquisitely horrifying reviews of this place on Yelp.com from when it was being renovated during the summer.   Well, the good news is that the renovation appears to be done and they did a terrific job. The room was clean, had lovely contemporary interior decor, and looked and smelled great. There is a small fridge in the room which is very quiet. Like all new hotels, they use RFID keycards.  The bad news is that it was not a perfect renovation.  There were still small but nagging clues in the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A few oddities but very clean and comfortable!
Summary: Stayed here only one night, be advised the parking, the self parking lot is in the back and shared with multiple hotel properties so its absolutely worthless unless you want to walk.  Take the valet, although it's pretty offensive at $26 a night.... seems like all properties in the area have decided rake tourists for as much as possible.  All employees were friendly and attentive, however with no uniforms whatsoever or at least consistent polo shirts or something, it had a weird feeling of friends n family taking over a large hotel.... which was odd and somewhat lacking in professionalism.  The room was clean and very comfortable, everything works and the central air/heat works great BUT the controls were from the 70's... manual sliders in this day/age !?!   The bed and bedding
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Father and son on the run.
Summary: This place is truly top notch. I want to express my gratitude to Gina. From the second my son and I walked in we were treated like family.   The property and rooms are immaculate.  Housekeeping is very professional as well, I asked for extra coffee at night and they were there in seconds.   Beds are comfy with luxurious linen.  Shower wand is an awesome plus. Shuttle service to Disneyland is reasonably priced as everything in this hotel.  You get so much more than what you pay for at Delta. Breakfast buffet is on point as well; where else can you get guava juice with breakfast!!!    Again, Thank you so much Gina, you truly made the experience with a cherry on top.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice room except for housekeeping thinking that I checked out of the room and disposing of my lunch and soda. The front desk offered to replace the drink which was nice but... It is across the street of four or five eating establishments.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 1. HVAC worked good. 2. No bad Smells. 3. Clean Room. 4. Comfortable beds. 5. Friendly Service.   This is what every Hotel should have,  but sad to say many Hotels don’t  consistently perform to stay consistent  With the basics !  Good Stay so far !
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this hotel as part of a package to Disneyland through Costco, they are a "partner" of Disneyland Hotels. I will first start off by saying that each employee we encountered on our trip was VERY friendly and helpful, so they definitely do well in that department...oh and the beds are very comfortable as well! The part where they lack, and a the reasons we will never be back to this hotel are for the following reasons:  1.) Self parking is $20/night or $26/night for valet. We choose to self park. However, this  they do not have a luggage cart you can use, only the people who valet and/or use their bellhop get the carts! There was a wedding going on at this time so we had to park in BFE and lug all our luggage to the rooms without a cart...not fun or easy!  2.) The buffet
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Watch Out For the Shower Wand!
Summary: This hotel is just a standard hotel, not bad, but not great either.  I stayed here years ago when it was a Crowne Plaza and decided to stay here again now that the hotel is under the Marriott umbrella.  My biggest issue with our room was the shower.  The bathroom and shower was very modern with chrome hardware.  I did not realize that the shower had a rectangular shower wand in addition to the shower head.  Unfortunately, housekeeping had the shower wand pointing towards outside of the shower rather pointing inside.  When I turned on the shower for the first time during my stay, the shower wand with excellent shower pressure, shot hot water straight into my eyes (very dangerous), face and drenched my shirt.  I was not pleased.  Housekeeping should be cognizant to make sure that
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fantastic customer service stands out from the moment you check-in to check-out.  Room was big, and seemed recently renovated. It was a little further from Disneyland, then what I am used to.  They had a shuttle that ran every 30 min that was very convenient.  Simply buy a ticket at the electronic kiosk in the lobby. ($6 adult, $3 kids- covers the whole day, to and from rides)  It drops you at the A1 hotel shuttle stop, which is very close to the gates. In my opinion the convenience of a 10 min shuttle ride versus a 10 min walk from a closer hotel was about the same.  They had valet parking, if you choose to drive. Across the parking lot were four restaurants, which made it very convenient to call in orders, and walk over to pick up after a long day at the parks. Mini fridge in
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wow, would have never thought to stay here. Needed a last minute room out here while working and this came up on my Marriott app. I’m glad it did, this is a very nice property and the room was very nice! Modern room, large and very clean. Great size bathroom as well. Check in staff very lightening quick and very friendly. Parking here can be a little confusing. This location literally sits between 2 hotels and all the same parking lot. There’s a decent walk from the parking lot to the lobby so beware of that. Multiple restaurants all walking distance. Disneyland up the street a few miles... great location for a Disney trip. Great hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wow! I can't say enough good things about this hotel!
Summary: We stayed at the Delta Hotel in Garden Grove/Anaheim. Wally greeted us with a smile, check in was quick and efficient and she had several great suggestions on restaurants and attractions nearby. She is a rockstar! Did I mention that she gave us an early check in and free upgrade?  Our room was recently upgraded. Clean, comfortable and large. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and the shower had the right temperature and pressure. Their amenities made my hair soft and manageable. My room had a great view of the city.   The pool and courtyard area was well maintained. They have the softest pool towels I've used. The room service was quick and tasty.   Housekeeping was professional and did a wonderful job. They were friendly and approachable. All of the valets
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here a few.  It is a great location.  If you are going to Disneyland there are frequent shuttles (for a fee).  It is a bit of a walk to the park, but totally doable. To me it is worth it to get away from the hustle and bustle.  There was a recent renovation to the rooms. My room was immaculate and super comfortable.  The bathroom was large and clean.  The bedding was fabulous.    If I had to criticize anything it would be the self parking lot.  It is behind the hotel and a little sketchy (not super well lit), but I have parked there a few times and it is totally fine.  Other than that it was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Superb Hotel, friendly staff and greeting with a smile.
Summary: We were very impressed with this hotel, very clean, friendly staff.  This hotel was only 10 minutes away from Disneyland, walking distance from Target other amities plus the walking distance from Outback and Starbucks.  The front staff Like Andrew, David Ngo, Jim who out of there way to please us with directions and places to eat in addition gave us a ride when we missed our bus.  They were always attentive to our needs and well being which was great.  I would highly recommend going to this hote
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was recently renovated.  Although they did not fully renovate the rooms (example, bathroom floor is still old orange tile), they did a nice job making it clean and modern. The bed was extremely comfortable. The staff were VERY friendly, I can't say enough about how they made us feel warm and welcomed. The Disneyland shuttle leaves from the hotel every 30 minutes, and provides a quick affordable way to get to the parks.  The hotel even leaves 2 bottles of water a day in the room. We enjoyed the toiletries too.  I would highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: OK hotel in a good location.
Summary: Bed was great.   Plenty of towels.  Disney shuttle stops there, and you can get an all-day ticket for $6; however, Uber gets you there faster and for only a few dollars more.  Nów...the bar—drinks are  expensive.  One ounce of Gran Marnier—$10!  One glass of wine from a $7 variety—$15!  Directly across the street from Target.
Manager Response: none

Summary: On the first day I notified the hotel that my room smelled like cigarette smoke. They said thanks for letting us know.  By the 3rd night there was a cigarette haze in our room. Clearly the folks in the next room were actively smoking.  You could smell it in the hallway and see and smell it in our room.  One member of management commented that our room smelled like a motel 6.    Initially the staff refused to knock on the smokers door because they had a “ do not disturb sign” on their door. Seriously what about me their smoke is bothering me for 3 days and the smokers in a non smoking hotel can’t be disturbed?    Day 4 - Mangement finally knocked on the door and did an inspection and though the room reeked of cigarette smoke, management saw no evidence of smoking taking place in

Summary Heading: This Hotel will steal your credit card number!
Summary: This place is awful! Not only was it a mediocre hotel, but the room was booked by my company, along with over one hundred of my co-workers, and the staff used my credit card (which they insisted was only to pay for incidentals) to pay for the room WITHOUT MY AUTHORIZATION! The worst part was when the problem was brought to their attention, (to be fair, quite a bit later) Claudia acknowledged that they had indeed erroneously charged my card, but refused to do anything about it.  She then told me that I'd have to talk to "Kevin" who mysteriously is unavailable whenever I call. The people in the billing office all but told me where I could shove my complaint. The only thing worse than a mediocre hotel? A mediocre hotel with BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Summary: This hotel was awful! The shower was broken so the water was cold for the majority of the shower without any warmth increase and then it would turn boiling hot. Unfortunately my two year old was in the shower with me when it turned boiling hot and was burnt. I’m thankful I was in there with her and able to get her out ASAP or it could have been tragic. I complained three times to the front desk on the second complaint they sent a maintenance man up who jiggled the handle and said he didn’t know. Third complaint I was told a manger would call me as one wasn’t on duty, still have yet to hear from anyone even after a formail written complaint on the Marriott website. Stay away from this place it’s awful and not worth the $$$ a night.

We were happy and will return in the future.

Summary Heading: There was THROW UP in the sink at check in!

Later that night I went to use the toilet and it didn’t flush at all. The next day took a shower and the water wouldn’t turn off when I finished. I went to the front desk to report all of this and I got a “oh yes you’re on the list for a VIP clean”...no I should have been offered a new room, an upgrade or if those weren’t possible, a free night or points to compensate for the troubles. And shouldn’t every room get a VIP clean? What does that even mean?? I have been a Starwood’s Preferred Guest since 2006 and I always stay at one of their hotels. Summary: This is not a JW Marriott. It's a Delta owned by Marriott.   It's a hotel near Disneyland and has its' little rip off quirks ($20 for parking). I went to a conference here and I will say Bravo! Most conferences make it too cold. The temperature the entire time was perfect. The stage was great. The seating good. I would attend another conference here. Only make sure you don't (as a group) or the veggie sandwiches through the hotel (just carrots and a few other vegetables). Summary: Stayed here in our second stop of a three stop honeymoon.  Easy enough to find. Parked for one night, there’s no parking in the front unless you choose valet which is pointless as you could walk the distance by the time they bring the car to you (witnessed this) large parking out the back which is easily findable but busy. Lobby area was nice. Lady who checked us in was helpful didn’t see the point in her acknowledging it was our honeymoon to then not even offer us a free drink at least unlike our other two hotels we stayed in (we told the company we booked with about the honeymoon so they knew in advance).  Rooms are out dated it’s like going back in time to the 60’s/70’s. Watch out for the air con unit ours was full of dust which was visible from the bed.  Bathroom was alright

The rooms are spacious and the beds are super comfy, we appreciated being able to get a great nights' sleep upon arriving after a flight delay and lengthy journey from the airport. Having a mini-fridge in the room is great, as it means you can buy in snacks, drinks and food from Target and save some serious cash! Summary Heading: Worst hotel, staff and experience ever!! Beware!!!

This was not specified in the booking reservation so I told her. She was very rude telling me I have to pay and there is no other parking area around which is not true actually. Ok.. fine I go to sleep. For the price I paid and the photos in the website I was expecting something totally different... old bathroom, yellow tiles, old forniture, very dirty, not even some water in the room or anything to drink, room very dark with no lights, old tv... like the worst hotel I have been ever. I say ok.. fine... then in the morning I find out breakfast price is other 17$ dollar per day. Also the housekeeping was very bad. Room was not cleaned

Summary Heading: Don't call to add alternate person to check in for this hotel.. You will regret.
Summary: Don't ever ask for alternate person check in for this hotel.  They will mess up everything and blame on you.  Instead of adding a alternate person to check in they replace the name for the reservation and create another reservation.  Then add your original booking name to the new reservation and charge you more for room per night in the new reservation.  You do not see the duplicate reservation activity anywhere.  I was in Marriott Reward every day for other booking.  You only see it when they charged you twice on  your same credit card  and stated no show  when you called Marriott customer care.  No points posting to my Marriott reward account and this is my last night challenge to gold status before I fly to Hawaii.   All this stupid challenge for nothing.   Frankly speaking

There was a resort fee-I don't like these but it seems many hotels are doing this now. Breakfast was not included and I feel rather pricy so we ate Breakfast and some dinners across the road-5 min walk-at Cocos.Excellent excellent little diner and highly recommended There was a pool although we did not use and what was really good was the free shuttle service to Disney.You had to get tickets each day but this was not a problem.The shuttle was located just outside

She talked to her front-end manager with whom my wife complained about the fee.  My wife said it is very deceptive to hotel customers without knowing about those extra fees stated clearly on hotels.com.  The front end manager said to my wife: " I will not waive that $20 parking fee". She raised her voice and pointed her finger at my wife.  We were shocked at her bad attitude and aggressive behavior. Summary: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago in Anaheim, CA. This is a former Wyndham that is now rebranded as Delta. Yellow tiles, dinky bath tub, streaming shower (does not work if you are tall), old TV (not CRT!), flower carpets, elevators with doors. No complimentary breakfast either.  The only thing going for this place are nearby hotels, two of them that are this bad (friends were staying). The biggest pull for this place is Disney down the street.   So that’s that. You can choose this hotel if you want to cherish these 1970s era features.

Summary Heading: 4th Stay and very last ever AVOID the bait and switch

Summary: Wyndham typically conjures up images of a classy lodge with modern rooms.  This one is the opposite. The wallpaper is tired and old, same with carpet and room.  The shower head is difficult for someone > 6 feet tall.    The reasonable price posted quickly is lost when you learn there is a $23 house keeping fee each day that is not disclosed until Check in.    Their cancellation policy is outdated and hints of a business that is starved for cash, ( 100% penalty <24 hours of check in) or weak on ethics.    There are too many good options in the area to settle for this place
Manager Response: Sorry to hear your stay was not within your expectations. The hospitality fee that was referred as not disclosed is always on the confirmation of every reservation.  During check in we validate what was communicated on paper. Feel free to reach the Office Manager and we would be happy to discuss any concerns that was not on your confirmation.  . We apologize for the inconvenience.   Thank you.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel near Disneyland plenty of local bars and restaurants
Summary: We stayed at the Wyndham Anaheim Garden Grove as part of our Disneyland trip. There is a resort fee but it includes the shuttle to Disneyland. The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. Across the road is Coco's, which serves a great (and cheap) breakfast, perfect for a big day in the park. There is also a handful of other restaurants within 2 minutes walk that are great for dinner.
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review. Definitely agree we have a great location for convenience.  We appreciate your business and look forward to any future stay with us.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights while at the NAMM conference. The positives were: very friendly staff, convenient location, excellent proximity to essentials and restaurants, comfortable bed, and overall good cleanliness. Negatives were: beat-up furniture (to be expected considering this hotel sees a lot of Disney use), fairly hard sell to attend a free breakfast about Wyndham resort properties, and resort fee that includes "free" wi-fi, free self parking (probably not used by most folks staying here) and a shuttle to Disneyland (OK--I can see this being a boon for some). Overall, while the property was clean, it still had a tiredness about it. While I would stay here again, I would probably first look for another place before booking this again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive feedback.  We do value your opinion and apologize for the negative input regarding the worn-down furniture and the tiredness of the overall room. We are aware of the concerns and the property will be going through some much-needed renovations soon. Before looking to another place, please review are website for the upcoming changes and give us another try.

Summary: The staff were very friendly and accommodating right from the minute I checked in. They were very generous with providing answers to our queries. The room is clean and spacious and has a beautiful view of the city. Having a shuttle service for guests makes it extremely convenient to get to places.
Manager Response: This is such a nice review and we thank you for acknowledging the staff and the hospitality they extended during your visit.  We look forward to your future stay with us.

Summary: My first time staying at a Wyndham! Absolutely loved it! The room was large and very accommodating with a fridge, safe and big bathroom. From the moment we checked in, Cindy at the front desk was so nice! Will definitely stay here again!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review.  We are happy Cindy made your stay memorable and extended great customer service.  We look forward to your future stay with us.

Summary: This hotel is very nice and clean!!! There is a bar downstairs. Location is great!!! Free shuttle to Disneyland!!! Cindy at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Definitely will stay here again!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review.  We agree location is great and convenient.  Cindy is warm and welcoming and appreciate the comment of her great customer service. Hope to see you for a future visit with us.

Summary: The Wyndham Garden Grove Anaheim has a nice lobby, that looks modern and well designed. But when you get up to the rooms, they are old and tired. Some examples: --stains on rugs in several rooms (I was travelling with a group) --one outlet by the bed and one by the desk, but not enough to charge all devices. No USB plug-ins. --bathroom is adequate but tub drain was malfunctioning in my room. It's an older set up that has been refreshed with a new shower curtain. --hallways have old wallpaper that is starting to show signs of age, and shabby carpets.  On the other hand, the hotel restaurant is quite decent and they do have room service. It's about a mile from the Anaheim Convention Center--you can walk or there is a free shuttle bus.  Next to the Wyndham (walking distance) are
Manager Response: Thank you for your input to our property.  We are definitely looking forward to being a luxury hotel soon. We are aware of the concerns and the property will be going through some updated changes. This will include renovations to all the rooms.  We agree location is a plus being near the convention center and Disneyland. Please review are website for the upcoming changes and give us another try.

Summary: Awesome hotel. Thanks to Kevin and Maribel for making my stay a pleasant one. Shower was bit broken but they managed to get it fixed when I came back. There's even a free shuttle to Disneyland and to the outlet. Great stay, good location.
Manager Response: Wow! Thank you so much for the compliments of the hotel and our staff.  We love hearing they accommodated your needs to fixing the shower upon your return.  We look forward to your future stay with us. Hopefully we can earn a 5 star.

Summary: Bed is super comfortable!! :):) clean and spacious room. Hotel staffs Kevin and Maribel are very friendly and willing to help!! :) room is fully equipped with hair dryer, ironing board and coffee maker 😊 tho the room is a little dim, I really like my stay :):):)
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review. We value the feedback and especially appreciate the comments on our staff being friendly and helpful.  About the dim room, we will be renovating soon look forward to the positive comments that we will receive with our great customer service.

Summary: Hotel and location were great.  The hotel is looking a bit aged and the handicapped bathroom needed a wirpe down on the
Manager Response: Thank your for the feedback and input.  We are aware of the aging concerns and our property will be going through some much-needed renovations soon. Please review are website for upcoming changes and give us another try.

Summary: Yady & Kevin have the most awesome customer service ever! It had been a great experience from you guys! We will be back to stay in Wyndham Anaheim Garden Grove Hotel again! Thank you so much and hope to come back to LA again!
Manager Response: Yay! Kevin and Yady for extending great customer service and a memorable stay.  We look forward to  your return visit with us. Thank You.

Summary: Had a business conference to attend in hotel. Rooms were great but no creamer or sugar in room for my coffee. Overall experience was great 👍🏼!
Manager Response: Thank your for the feedback and we will be sure to communicate to housekeeping the coffee amenities not being available. Appreciate your business and stay with us.

Summary: The amenities were nice. Clean rooms. Nice restaurant and cafe downstairs. Friendly customer service. Rooms were good. Only complaints: (a) bathtub backed up and did not drain well and (b) extra fees charged. We used a AAA discount and card was billed in advance of stay. However, hotel asked us to agree to a "hospitality fee" ($23) when we checked in and then subsequently charged us a "hospitality fee tax ($25.47) on our final bill. There were also additional 17% occupancy taxes charged for each night. I prefer not paying fees. So we ended up paying an additional $60 beyond the initial deposit for nothing but extra fees. Fees should be explicit and put into the original quote and deposit. What you agree to pay on the front end of your stay should be what you pay upon leaving. A
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive feedback regarding the amenities that came as a convenience during your stay. We apologize for the condition of the backed-up tub.  This sometimes can be a concern especially considering the location of being very busy throughout the season.  About the hospitality fee we hope to change this process soon when we convert our brand name to Marriott.  We will have a different method of  guest paying for what is utilized during their visit.  We value your opinion and hope to have a return visit when we change our brand and culture.

Summary Heading: Room Was Not In Good Shape
Summary: Our room smelled old/musty.  Dresser was broken.  Big stain on rug as you entered the room.  Dust around the bed frame.
Manager Response: We apologize for the condition of the room standards. We are looking forward to our newly remodeled renovations that will occur very soon. I can reassure the cleanliness of the rooms is exceptional. We do hope you will consider a return visit after the updates of the room conditions. Thank you for the feedback.

Summary: Rooms were old, furniture run down. Big groups were booked of high school kids that were very loud. Rooms were not very soundproof. Had 3 rooms for family. Manager Response: We apologize for the condition of the room standards.  We are looking forward to our newly remodeled renovations that will occur very soon. Our property is tailored to many educational events and conferences and young teenagers can be a little to joyful.  We do hope  you will consider a return visit after the updates of the room conditions.
